turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hi, I'm calling because I think I was overcharged on my last bill. It seems higher than usual.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Hello! I'm sorry to hear that. I can certainly look into that for you. Could you please provide your account number?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: It's 1234567890. This is ridiculous, I pay this bill every month and now it's like twice as much. I'm really frustrated.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Thank you. Okay, I'm pulling up your account now. I see a charge for $200 more than usual. It looks like there was an additional charge for international calls this month. Do you recognize these calls?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: International calls? No! I didn't make any international calls. That's completely wrong. How can I even check what specific numbers were called?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I understand your frustration. Unfortunately, the system doesn't allow me to provide you with the specific numbers at the moment. However, I can confirm the dates and times. Would you like me to provide that information?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Well, that's not helpful at all! How am I supposed to dispute this without knowing the numbers? And, who is responsible for this limitation? This feels like a huge disadvantage to the customer.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I understand your concern. While I cannot directly access the specific numbers, I can escalate this to a senior agent who can further investigate the call details and potential billing errors. Would you like me to do that?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Yes, please. That would be great. Thank you for offering to help further.
